question_text: A 58-year-old man is evaluated for right leg fatigue and cramping when walking 25 yards. His feet are shown following elevation (top) and during dependent positioning (bottom).
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is peripheral artery disease (PAD) involving the right lower extremity (Option C). In the Buerger test for assessing arterial perfusion, the patient's foot color is observed when it is elevated and again when it is dependent. The likelihood ratio of a positive finding (elevation pallor and dependent rubor) in the symptomatic extremity is 2.8 for PAD. This patient has right foot pallor with elevation and dependent rubor, consistent with the diagnosis of PAD.
